Animals¶

The animals module¶

This module provides classes implementing the animals on the Island.

class biosim.animals.Animal(properties)[source]¶

Parent class for herbivores and carnivores.

Initializing Animal class by asserting property values are valid.

Parameters:properties (dict) – Contains animal properties species, fitness, age and weight.
classmethod GET_DEFAULT_PARAMS()[source]¶

Returns a copy of the default animal parameters.

Returns:Copy of default animal parameters
Return type:dict
add_eaten_fodder_to_weight(fodder)[source]¶

Adds amount of weight to animals total body weight given by \(\beta \cdot F\). Also resets have_moved_this_year to False.

Parameters:fodder (float) – Amount of fodder available to the animal
birth_process(num_animals)[source]¶

If birth takes place, a birth weight is returned and weight of mother is reduced according to given formula.

Returns:Returns weight of the baby that is born, or None if no baby is born.
Return type:float, None
static convert_dict_to_list_and_array(moving_prob_for_each_loc)[source]¶

Converts dictionary with locations as keys and probabilities as values to a list of locations and a numpy array of probabilities.

Parameters:moving_prob_for_each_loc – Contains the locations of each

surrounding cell as keys, and the probabilities for the animal to move to each of them as values. :type: dict :return: List of locations of neighbouring cells, numpy array of the

probabilities of moving to each.
Return type:list, array
find_fitness()[source]¶

Updates fitness. Fitness is zero if weight is zero, otherwise given by

\[q^{+}(a, a_{\frac{1}{2}}, \phi_{age}) \cdot q^{-} (w, w_{\frac{1}{2}}, \phi_{weight})\]

where

\[q^{\pm}(x, x_{\frac{1}{2}}, \phi) = \frac{1}{1 + e^ {\pm \phi(x-x_{\frac{1}{2}})}\]
find_new_coordinates(neighbours_of_current_cell)[source]¶

Uses cumulative probability to decide which of the neighbouring cells the animal will move to. Returns the coordinates of that cell.

Parameters:neighbours_of_current_cell (dict) – Neighbours of current cell. Locations as keys, instance of landscape class as value.
Returns:The location the animal will move to.
Return type:tuple
find_rel_abund_of_fodder(landscape_cell)[source]¶

Takes an instance of a landscape class and returns the relative abundance of fodder in that instance, given by

\[\epsilon = \frac{f_k}{(n_k + 1)F^'}\]
Parameters:landscape_cell (dict) – Instance of landscape class
Returns:Relative abundance of fodder
Return type:float
make_animal_one_year_older()[source]¶

Adds 1 year to the age of the animal for each cycle.

prob_death()[source]¶

Finds probability of death, which depends on the fitness of the animal.

Returns:1 if fitness is zero, \(\omega \cdot (1 - \phi)\) otherwise
Return type:float, int
prob_give_birth(num_animals)[source]¶

Checks that weight of animal is more than given limit. If so, probability of giving birth is calculated from \(min(1, \gamma \cdot \phi \cdot (N-1)\)

Parameters:num_animals (int) – Number of animals of same species in cell
Returns:The probability for the animal to give birth.
Return type:float
prob_move_to_each_neighbour(neighbours_of_current_cell)[source]¶

Iterates through the dict of neighbours to the current cell. Finds the probability of moving to each of the neighbouring cells. Returns a dict mapping cell locations to the probability of moving there.

Parameters:neighbours_of_current_cell (dict) – Neighbours of current cell. Locations as keys, instance of landscape class as value.
Returns:Locations of each surrounding cell as keys, probabilities for the animal to move to each of them as values.
Return type:dict
prob_of_animal_moving()[source]¶

Computes the probability of moving at all, which depends on the animal’s fitness.

Returns:Probability of moving
Return type:float
propensity_move_to_each_neighbour(neighbours_of_current_cell)[source]¶

Finds the propensity for the animal to move to each of it’s neighbours.

Parameters:neighbours_of_current_cell (dict) – Contains neighbours of current cell. Location as keys, instance of landscape class as value
Returns:Maps location to it’s propensity.
Return type:dict
classmethod reset_params()[source]¶

Sets the animal parameters equal to default.

return_new_coordinates(neighbours_of_current_cell)[source]¶

Checks whether the animal will move or not, and if so, returns the new coordinates.

Parameters:neighbours_of_current_cell (dict) – Neighbours of current cell. Locations as keys, instance of landscape class as value.
Returns:Location animal will move to.
Return type:tuple or None
weight_loss()[source]¶

Substracts given amount of weight from the animals total weight after each cycle, given by \(\eta \cdot weight\).

will_animal_live()[source]¶

Checks the probability of death. Returns True if the animal lives.

Returns:True is animal lives
Return type:bool
will_animal_move()[source]¶

Compared probability of animal moving and a random number to decide whether the animal should move.

Returns:True if animal will move, False if not.
Return type:bool
will_birth_take_place(num_animals)[source]¶

Checks probability of giving birth and returns True if a baby is to be born.

Returns:True if animal shall give birth
Return type:bool
class biosim.animals.Herbivore(properties)[source]¶

Class for herbivores.

Initializes herbivore animal with given properties. :param properties: dict storing age, weight and fitness of herbivore

find_rel_abund_of_fodder(landscape_cell)[source]¶

Takes an instance of a landscape class, and returns the relative abundance of fodder for herbivores in that instance, given by

\[\epsilon = \frac{f_k}{(n_k + 1)F^'}\]
Parameters:landscape_cell (dict) – Instance of landscape class
Returns:Relative abundance of fodder
Return type:float
class biosim.animals.Carnivore(properties)[source]¶

Class for Carnivores.

Initializes carnivore animal with given properties.

Parameters:properties (dict) – Contains age, weight and fitness of herbivore.
eat(pop_herb)[source]¶

Iterates through list of herbivores, and implements kill method on one herbivore at the time until carnivore has satisfied it’s appetite or has tried to kill all herbivores without luck.

Parameters:pop_herb (list) – Herbivores available to the carnivore sorted by fitness
Returns:List of herbivores killed
Return type:list
find_rel_abund_of_fodder(landscape_cell)[source]¶

Takes an instance of a landscape class, and returns the relative abundance of fodder in that instance, given by

\[\epsilon = \frac{f_k}{(n_k + 1)F^'}\]
Parameters:landscape_cell – Instance of landscape class
Type:dict
Returns:Relative abundance of fodder for the carnivore
Return type:float
kill(herb)[source]¶

Implements prob_kill and a random number to decide whether a carnivore kills or not.

Parameters:herb (class '__main__.Herbivore') – Herbivore to be killed
Returns:True if carnivore shall kill
Return type:bool
prob_kill(fitness_herb)[source]¶

Calculates the probability of a carnivore killing a herbivore.

Parameters:fitness_herb (float) – Fitness of herbivore
Returns:Probability of carnivore killing a herbivore
Return type:int, float
